exchange-description: International exchange of carpenting craftsmanship skills.
exchange-keywords: traditional skills, carpenters, international, craftsmanship, exchange, , craftsmen, Germany, Japan
exchange-intro: In the past craftsmen from around the world gathered to share their native methods. Their common thought 'making homes connecting life'.
exchange-2005-desc: Taking part in an international exchange to teach traditional Japanese skills and learn traditional Western skills in Germany for the first time.
exchange-2007-desc: Building a large Torii in Germany with craftsmen from 5 different countries.
exchange-2010-desc: Hosting the 'Chiisa-na Kezurokai in Ichinose' in Koushuu-shi Inchinose. carpenters from Germany, England, Belgium, Sweden, Austria and Japan (70 in total) built two huts using only hand tools; a Japanese style and a European style.
finish-keywords: carpentry, adze finishing, masakari finishing, wooden shingles, clay wall, amemiya-daiku
about-description: Traditional Japanese Carpentry by Kunihiro Amemiya, founder of Amemiya-daiku.
about-keywords: Amemiya-daiku, Kunihiro Amemiya, traditional Japanese carpentry, carpenter, craftsmanship, wood, wooden homes, traditional skills, expert of the wood, Joumon skills, timber skills
about-intro-1: Amemiya-daiku is located in Yamanashi-prefecture, Enzan, Japan. The company's foreman is Amemiya Kunihiro. The company focuses on traditional Japanese carpentry techniques. Techniques such as squaring logs with the Japanese broadaxe and adze, cutting large timbers in boards with the wide bladed-ripsaw and the traditional way of assembling the frame using the mortise and tenon and more complicated joints. The objective is to build sustainable environmental friendly homes. This by using as much hand tools as possible, manual labor and ancient knowledge and skills. The homes are not only friendly for their surroundings but also for their inhabitants. By living close to nature, the true meaning of a home can come true: comforting peoples mind. Local materials such as trees and earth are used. This in order to keep the ecological footprint as low as possible from the beginning of the building process.
about-intro-2: The company offers: small huts were you can experience an outer space - minka reform and renovation - free earthquake resistance diagnosis.
about-history-1: Born in Koushuu (graduated from Nichikawa Senior Highschool).
about-history-2: Starting his apprenticeship as a carpenter by his father Amemiya Kunio.
about-history-3: Becoming an independent carpenter, Amemiya-daiku is born.
about-history-4: Winning the prefectural skills competition of Yamanashi.
about-history-5: Taking part in the reconstruction of 1600 year old skills at the Yamanashi 'kai choushizuka kofun'.
about-history-6: Taking part in recording traditional skills for the ministry of culture of France and the Takenaka Carpentry Tools museum.
about-history-7: Being acknowledged as an 'expert of the wood' by the National Land Afforestation Promotion Organization.
about-history-8: Involved in investigating Joumon-era lifestyle at the Ishikawa prefectural Iwaki historic ruins (splitting timber and stone axe hewing).
about-history-9: Hosting the 'Chiisa-na Kezurokai in Ichinose' in Ichinose.
